fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45816].
  {panel}

h3. Attempting to restore a backup from JIRA Cloud (latest version: 7.0.0-OD-08) to JIRA 6.4.12 throws the following error. 
{quote}The file you are trying to import is from JIRA 7.0.0-OD-08-001, which is newer than your current version of JIRA and will not work. The import file claims it can be successfully imported into JIRA 6.4.12 or later.
If JIRA 6.4.12 is not yet available for download, please contact support.{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import a current Cloud backup into JIRA 6.4.12 following these steps:https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-jira-server-299569790.html

h3. Expected Results

The error should be updated to read that it can be successfully imported into JIRA 7.0

h3. Actual Results
The error is thrown and the user cannot proceed.
 
h3. Notes
The import was working last week Oct 8th prior to the JIRA 7 features being released into the Cloud environment.

h3.Workaround
Import the data into JIRA 7.0
fields.summary: Can’t restore JIRA 7 Cloud backup to JIRA 6.4.12 Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45813].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Due date accepts incompatible dates to the configured Date/Time format if manually edited.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)

Tested on JIRA 6.4.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a ticket with the default date format
# Fill the Due Date with the date picker
# Change the Day/Month/Year format to "dd/MMM/yyyy"
# Go back to the issue and edit the Date in the Due Date field to something like: 01/01/20016

h3. Expected Results

JIRA would show a message like when an invalid type of date is included in a field (this already happens when you try to include a month as number instead of name): You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy", eg. "16/Oct/15". 

h3. Actual Results

JIRA allows the change to be made. This will make filters stop searching for that issue if based on the due date field, since the date is messed up.

h3.Workaround

Use the default model or just restrict the year back to "yy" in the Day/Month/Year format field.
fields.summary: Invalid Dates are being accepted in the Due Date field
Spelling correction change 'not' to 'note'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45810].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, the MD5 is only available for JIRA installer (exe, bin, zip, tar.gz) only.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the MD5 download options for Atlassian supported add-ons as well, such as JIRA Agile, JIRA Capture, etc
fields.summary: Having the MD5 download option for Atlassian supported add-ons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45805].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Summary*
A user based on his organization's requirement might need to show more than the allowed 50 results on a dashboard's filter gadget.

However due to the current restriction of only 50, the organization would not be able to use any gadget satisfactorily to match their requirements.

Can a feature be added(be it dark feature) that allows users to increase this limit, should a user proceed to use it however, a warning can be shown informing them about possible  performance issues and they can proceed with using it agreeing that they are aware of the risks involved.

*Expected Result*
Users are able to increase the amount of issues from a filter result beyond 50.

*Actual Result*
Users are restricted to 50 and this cannot be increased any where.

There is a suggested workaround for JIRA 6.3.X [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Increase+the+Number+of+Results+to+display+on+the+Filter+Results+Dashboard+Gadget] however this does not work for JIRA 6.4.X.
fields.summary: Allow Users the ability to increase number of Filter result beyond 50 in a gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition

fields.summary: As admin , would like to disable clone feature for a Project / User / Group

fields.description:

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There's a difference in the method to compile an add-on in JIRA 6.x as compared to 5.x.

h3. Suggested Solution
Document the changes for easier reference
fields.summary: Document changes made in compiling add-ons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45796].
  {panel}

Example:

I often use the screenshot tool built into my OS, which generates files with names like +Screenshot from 2015-10-15 13:37:04.png+. When I try to insert one into a JIRA ticket, I'm told that the filename contains invalid characters, and that I need to

# Remove the attachment from the Issue.
# Open a separate piece of software on my system.
# Rename the image.
# Upload the same file to your server a second time.

This is a pretty ridiculous example of user-hostility. Your server successfully receives a file, has all the resources it needs to move forward, and does the opposite instead. Why not just strip or replace the characters you don't want to use on your end, or ask the user to input a different name to use?
fields.summary: Handling of invalid characters in attachment filenames too intolerant
ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor logs "dangerous" warnings if thread holds database connection for 5 minutes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45793].
  {panel}

i haven't tried Jira 7 yet, but in Jira 6.4.12 the JDBC driver version is postgresql-9.0-801.jdbc4.jar and this is really old.

Even Confluence has been shipping JDBC postgresql-9.4-1202-jdbc41.jar.

We are using PostgreSQL 9.4 right now, so pushing JIRA's bundled JDBC to as close to 9.4 driver would be ideal.

I am not sure why JIRA is still behind Confluence.

As a matter of fact, why is Confluence's bundling it under CONF_INSTALL/confluence/WEB-INF/lib while Jira is bundling JDBC under JIRA_INSTALL/lib/

Thanks.
fields.summary: Update JIRA PostgreSQL JDBC driver

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45792].
  {panel}

Hey Team,

I'm raising support/feedback request as per suggestion by Nick and Luke from Developer Relations team.

I'm submitting one idea as part of Atlassian Codegeist: http://devpost.com/software/atlassian-command-line As part of this, I need to JIRA, Confluence and other atlassian tools to test the project. As per suggestion, I've registered for Atlassian.net account: https://pongbot.atlassian.net

Want to make sure usage of this account and products associated to it remains free. Nick suggested me I should open a ticket with Developer Relations team and your team will take care of it.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you very much for all help,
Raju
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand free usage

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45790].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian team,

In Jira, we can create role, group...
However, it should be nice to create schema of role for project.
Why? In current JIRA, each time you create new role, they appear in project role. Some role have almost same name than other role, and they aren't used by this project.
If we can choose a schema of role we can choose the role used by project only and hide unused roles (that allow to see needed role only and we aren't flooded by not needed role).
Thanks in advance for your help.
Sorry if suggestion already exist but i don't see it.

Regards,
Mickael
fields.summary: Create project role schema

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45788].
  {panel}

h3.Summary
There seems to be a weird bug where users can choose workflow scheme for their project. They can choose a scheme named *default* (which is *Default Workflow Scheme*) from the drop down but when they go to workflow scheme the *Default Workflow Scheme* is not listed there.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Navigate to {{https://<ATLASSIAN_INSTANCE_NAME>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<PROJECT_KEY>/workflows}}.
# Select *default* as the scheme.
# You will notice that the workflow scheme is named *Default Workflow Scheme*.
# If you go to the *Workflow Scheme* page however, you will not find it any where on the list.

h3.Expected Result
*Default Workflow Scheme* should be seen in the *Workflow Scheme*.

h3.Current Result
*Default Workflow Scheme* is not listed in the *Workflow Scheme*.
fields.summary: 'Default Workflow Scheme' missing from Workflow Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45787].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
If a user attempt to edit the context of a custom field in IE, the due to the size specified in the Select field for both project and issue type, the slider is unavailable to the user.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Go to the configure page of a custom field.
# Select the Edit Configuration.
# In the Select field sections of the page, the slider is unavailable so users would need to press the up and down arrow to sort through the options available to them.

*Cause*
The available select option size set is too small for the slider to appear.
{code}<select name="issuetypes" size="5" multiple "">.......</select>{code}
- Increasing the size above to about 10 would make the slider appear if the select option is long enough.

*Expected Result*
User would be able to use the slider to navigate faster as seen in Chrome and Firefox browsers.

*Actual Result*
Slider is not available hence user would need to press the arrow buttons till they get to the option they want to select.

*Workaround*
(i) The below is meant for JIRA 6.4.X and below and has not been tested with JIRA 7.X
# Create a CSS file with the following code:{code}select {	
	height:180px;
}{code}
# Add the file to {{JIRA Installation > atlassian-jira > includes}} folder.
# Open JIRA and go to Announcement Banner page.
#* Go to {{Admin > System > Announcement Banner}} page.
# In the field available add the following {code}<LINK href="http://<jiraserver>/includes/<mystyle.css>" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">{code}
# The above would increase the field size and should your option be more than the height specified, the slider would appear.
fields.summary: Increase the Size of Select field in Context page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45786].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA's REST API currently provides response only in JSON format. Users migrating from JIRA's SOAP and XML-RPC remote APIs may also miss this particularly.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide XML formats for REST API outputs as well, for additional convenience.
fields.summary: Extend REST API to support XML response

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45785].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Based on the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/checking-the-progress-of-a-version-720416820.html#Checkingtheprogressofaversion-UnderstandingtheReleasepage], its stated:
{quote}
1. Only one of these will be displayed — the most recent one. 
2. If multiple items have the same timestamp, the one that will be displayed is determined by this priority: *pull requests > reviews > commits > branches.*
{quote}

If follow this steps:
# Create a review on the issue A.
# Add a commit message for issue A after 5 minutes.
# It will shows *reviews* instead of *commits* on the *Development* column from the Release progress page. 

It seems JIRA doesn't respect the first condition if *reviews* and *commits* are having different timestamp. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It should follow the first condition as mentioned in the documentation. If not, please update the documentation to the latest use case to avoid any further confusion in the future.
fields.summary: Release project development progress use case

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45783].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Currently admin is not able to reorder the custom fields while moving an issue from 1 project to another.

*Suggested Solution*

User would like to have function to reorder the custom fields according to their need while moving an issue from 1 project to another.

*Workaround*

Create separate screens for issue types for both projects. For example if you have Project A & Project B and you are trying to move Issue 1 from Project A to Project B. After moving the issue, since you have separate issue type screen scheme for Project B, you can configure the screen manually.
fields.summary: Reorder Custom Field when moving an Issue from 1 Project to another

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45781].
  {panel}

Display clearer message when Issue Search is not displaying all messages

Currently, the JIRA Issue search will display a message on the final page of results stating that no more issues will be displayed as the number of issues returned are limited, however this can be easy to miss - especially after looking over so many results.

In addition, itt is not possible to reach the last page directly (you have to click on the icon-button "->" to go from page to page) so it is not possible to immediately view that the result is truncated. 

A message near the number of issues found, on the first page (or all pages) of results would be clearer.
fields.summary: Display clearer message when Issue Search is not displaying all messages
Support wildcard matching in user search
Show Crucible Reviews on Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45771].
  {panel}

My apologies if this is a duplicate.  I have searched for this topic, but have not found a match.

Viewing an avatar is tied to the Browse Users global permission.  In our instance, this permission is granted to authenticated users within a certain group.  However, some Kanban boards are viewable to anonymous users.  This leads to the issue.

Steps to reproduce:
* Ensure only authenticated users within certain groups have Browse Users permissionj
* Enable anonymous view only access to a Kanban board
* View a Kanban board without logging in
** the avatars displayed will be the system defaults.  
* Authenticate and view the same board
** the default avatars are still displayed.
* Logout
* Clear the browser cache
* Login (before viewing the board as an anonymous user)
* View the board
** The proper custom avatars will be displayed

It looks like the default avatars are being cached as the named avatars.  Subsequent requests are getting the avatars from the browser cache, even though there is a real avatar now available as an authenticated user.
fields.summary: Custom avatars not displaying after viewing user as unauthenticated user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45769].
  {panel}

*Summary*
Unlike Confluence, JIRA does not have auto-suggestion in the search.

*Suggestion*
It is nice to have if we can implement Auto-suggestion feature like Confluence in JIRA
fields.summary: To enable Auto-suggestion in JIRA search
Remove Accept remote API calls option from Configuring JIRA application options documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45767].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently by default JIRA doesn't allow any two factor authentication.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we could integrate JIRA with Radius server which will allow two factor authentication to be setup with ease 

h3. Customer justification
{panel}
We want to open up JIRA outside of the network for external consultants, but due to strict policies we have to have two-factor authentication in place.
We used Duo Security for a while. They had made a plugin for JIRA that made this possible. If you tried to log on to JIRA outside of our network, Duo's system kicked in and asked for authentication via sms / mobile app. Upon succesfull authentication you were then routed into JIRA. 
Unfortunetly they havent kept the plugin up to date, so it stopped working with newer versions of JIRA.
All of our internal users have access to JIRA functions via their Active Directory user (be it jira-users or customers for our JSD), and with a Radius server in between to handle the authentication of the users we could use Duo Integration with Radius to get the two-factor solution in place using their AD users.
{panel}
fields.summary: integrate JIRA with Radius server
Ability to Remove Custom Field from Application/Add-ons if it is not Licensed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

*Issue Summary*
A user may decide to filter issues based on the project lead so they can monitor the issues that belong to the said project.

Unfortunately this is currently impossible.

*Expected Result*

*Actual Result*

h3. Problem Definition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45755].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When you create a project of a particular type e.g. a Business project, some Project Shortcuts are added by default. If for any reason you would not like to have this project shortcuts added by default, you would have to remember to delete them every time a new project is created, because each new project comes with the default shortcuts pre-assigned.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a way to delete or disable default project shortcuts permanently
fields.summary: Allow a way to disable default project shortcuts
Transitioning from jTDS to Microsoft JDBC Driver for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45751].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Issue with (at) @ mentions when attempting to add comment for user. @mentions only populates  with user's lastname and (not firstname) on 1st attempt. Issues is intermittent but reproducible. 

h3. Environment
JIRA CLOUD
7.0.0-OD-07-011JIRA CLOUD
Chrome: Version 45.0.2454.101 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into Instance > Open any issue and click Comment
# Type @ and 1st 3 letter of firstname > User doesn't show up.
# Remove text, try again. Type @first 3 letters of lastname > User comes up
# Remove text, try again. Type @first 3 letters of firstname > user now comes up

h3. Expected Results
User to come up with @mention with both firstname and lastname on the first try.

h3. Actual Results
User doesn't show up with firstname only with last name on first attempt. 

h3. Notes/Comments
If page is refreshed the same issue will occur and user will need to type in @lastname again for @firstname to work.

Was able to reproduce in both IE and Firefox as well. 

h3.Workaround
Type @lastname in comments for user to show up. Once user shows up you can type @firstname and user will show up in dropdown list.
fields.summary: At @mentions not working correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45750].
  {panel}

*Current Implementation*

Currently when I have more than a certain number of filters (12?  Or perhaps a dynamic number), I am only able to see _some_ of these filters when I click on the Issues dropdown.  See attached image.

*Suggested Implementation*

As a user, I would like to be able to prioritize the order of my filters, so I can determine which ones appear on the Issues.  Ideally the implementation will include at least one of the following:

- Sort order on the Manage Filters page which clearly shows which filters will be visible in the Issues menu and which won't.
- Ability to sort filters by date created on Manage Filters page and have them visible in this order on the Issues dropdown.
- By default, displaying filters on Issues menu in order of CreatedDate descending.  Older filters will be pushed off the Issues dropdown unless they are rearranged on Manage Filters page.

Thanks for listening!
fields.summary: Prioritize the order of my custom filters on the Issues dropdown menu.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45749].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When accessing JIRA from the native Windows Phone browser, the mobile site gets not displayed. Instead, users see the desktop site.

h3. Expected Results
You'd be directed to the mobile site.

h3. Actual Results
You'll see the desktop version of the site.

h3.Workaround
Users can install the UC Browser available in the [Microsoft Marketplace|https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/store/apps/uc-browserhd/9wzdncrfj3kn] and change the user agent:
# Go to "Web Preference (UA)" in UC browser.
# Change the user agent, select "Android" for example.
# Open JIRA, it will start with the mobile interface.
fields.summary: JIRA does not display the mobile site on Windows Phone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45748].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Corrupt caches or invalid data could occur in one or more nodes on a clustered environment (JDC). Therefore, it is not practical to shut down all nodes to refresh or clear out JIRA cache.

h4. Workaround
Restart all JIRA nodes to update the in-memory plugin related caches

h4. Proposed Solution
Provide an option to refresh plugin/application caches runtime across all nodes to prevent invalid data to be synced.
fields.summary: Provide a better way of clearing cache for JIRA Data Center (Cluster)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45747].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating a new issue from JIRA and dragging and dropping an attachment, it will prevent interaction with the currently loaded issue, whether the issue is actually created or not.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.0.0-OD-08-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Visit any issue in JIRA (the issue only occurs on top of another issue, not from dashboard)
# Click to *Create* a new issue
# Drag an attachment to the window, being careful not to drag it to the actual attachment panel. It must select the whole page, like this:
!Screen Shot 2015-10-12 at 16.18.58.jpg|thumbnail!
# Either submit the ticket or click cancel.
# Attempt to click anything that can usually be interacted with on the ticket that remains on the screen

h3. Expected Results
You would normally be able to click around on the issue that remains behind.

h3. Actual Results
No errors in the logs, nothing in Network Console.

h3.Workaround
* Manually attach file by clicking *Browse*
* Drag directly to attachment panel
fields.summary: Dragging and dropping attachment on inline issue creation prevents interaction with JIRA
Upgrading JIRA Data Center documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45728].
  {panel}

If I want to filter on issues that do not have a particular label in them, for example "XYZ", I expected to do this:

Labels not in (XYZ)

However this filter doesn't work correctly. It only returns issues that have labels, but those labels do not include XYZ. So issues with no labels are excluded from this filter.

To get what I want I have to do this to get the correct result:

Labels not in (XYZ) OR Labels is Empty

I did some searching and found that others have had the same issue, but I am not sure if this behavior is intended or if it is a bug that never got resolved.  Please let me know which is the case!
fields.summary: Using "Labels not in (XYZ)" in JQL Ignores Issues with No Labels
Include JIRA Latest on JIRA Downloads Archive page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45719].
  {panel}

h4.Problem Definition

Currently, there is no way to enable *send notification* option from Labels screen by default.

h4.Suggested Solution

It would be great if admin user can enable the *send notification* option from the Labels screen globally.

h4.Workaround
# Backup JIRA.
# Open the {{labelsform.jsp}} file via {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/secure/view/issue/}} directories.
# Search for the {{id="send-notifications"}} parameter and put the entry {{value="true"}} there.
# Save the file and restart JIRA.
(i) Please do this in a staging environment and verify is working.
fields.summary: Ability to set default notification for Labels issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45713].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Not able to view and delete any screens because a deleted screen is still associated with a workflow transition.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a screen;
 # Create a new workflow that uses that screen on a transition;
 # Delete the screen in Jira;

Note: The system does not provide a link to delete screens, unless the screen has no associated workflows or screen schemes. This could be bypassed by manipulating the URL on the delete screen page. The validation on the screen deletion page is also not blocking screen deletion. Some of the tickets raised have mentioned failed imports, we have not confirmed this as the source of the screen deletion. 
h3. Expected Results

The screen deletion page should show an error message and prevent screen deletion.

The screens page still shows a list of all existing screens despite the existence of a missing screen in a workflow.
h3. Actual Results

The screen deletion page allows the screen to be removed.

The screens page shows a blank list of screens.
h3. Workaround

Open a support ticket mentioning this bug.
fields.summary: Screens page blank due to a deleted screen associated with a workflow transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.summary: Register "Invite User" events in audit log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45704].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a mail is sent to JIRA, if the mail lacks a body and only contains the attachment, JIRA create the issue but does not add the attachment.

In the logs, JIRA will dump the following exception:

{noformat}
2015-10-08 15:59:51,161 QuartzScheduler_Worker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    Incoming Test [com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils] Could not find any body to extract from the message
{noformat}

The mail that generated this exception is:

{noformat}
Date: Mon, 01 Oct 2015 12:01:01 -0400
From: Some User <some_user@domain.com>
Subject: Test Email
To: <jira@mycompany.com>
Message-ID: <userbla@message-id>
Content-Type: application/pdf; name="myfile.pdf"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-Description: myfile
Return-Path: some_user@domain.com
MIME-Version: 1.0

[base-64-representing-myfile.pdf-here]
{noformat}

However, if you receive the message below:

{noformat}
Date: Mon, 01 Oct 2015 12:01:01 -0400
From: Some User <some_user@domain.com>
Subject: Test Email
To: <jira@mycompany.com>
Message-ID: <userbla@message-id>
Return-Path: some_user@domain.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=atlassian-test

--atlassian-test
Content-Type: application/pdf; name="myfile.pdf"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-Description: myfile

[base-64-representing-myfile.pdf-here]

--atlassian-test
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii 
{noformat}

Then JIRA will create the mail successfully.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the mail handling in JIRA to accept the first type of message as some systems send mails like that. (I.E: SAP NetWeaver, SQL Server Reports)
fields.summary: Add attachments to issues from emails without body

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45703].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Prior to JIRA 7.0, the date picker would highlight the current date when first opened from an issue. As of JIRA 7.0, it highlights yesterday's date instead on *Safari*, *Firefox* and *Internet Explorer*.

h3. Expected Behavior
Have the current date highlighted in the date picker, no matter which browser is used.

h3. Actual Behavior
Yesterday's date is highlighted on *Safari*, *Firefox* and *Internet Explorer*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On any field with JIRA's default date picker, click the 'calendar icon' while accessing JIRA through *Safari*, *Firefox* or *Internet Explorer*.

h3. Workaround
Manually select the date or use *Chrome*.
fields.summary: Yesterday's date highlighted in date picker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.3.12+Release+Notes
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.3.9+Release+Notes

"JIRA Issues Macro: JIRA project does not exist or you do not have permission to view it. "

h3. Problem Definition
By default, subtasks only shows name, issue ID, and issue type when viewed in the parent issue. While there is a workaround in server to [configure to display custom field of the sub-task in the parent issue screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=720415962] this is not possible for JIRA Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a method to configure to display custom field of the sub-task in the parent issue screen in JIRA Cloud.
fields.summary: Allow Configuration of the View of Sub-Task in Parent Issue

fields.description:

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
No long ago the JRA-45379 bug report was opened because of a bug in the JMWE plugin. 

This bug was closed, since it was happening on a third-party add-on. 

In the bug itself, a representative from Inovalog said this bug was fixed in a new version: 4.0.0-Cloud-Beta7.

Since this add-on is pre-installed, an upgrade is necessary to fix the bug. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Upgrade the add-on to 4.0.0-Cloud-Beta7.
fields.summary: Update Jira Misc Workflow Extensions in Cloud instance to fix Bug

fields.description:

  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Currently admin is not able to view hidden fields in the fields section of the project admin and they need to edit the field configuration scheme to see that the field is hidden.

 !Test.png|thumbnail! 


*Suggested Solution*

User would like to have function to enable/hide hidden fields directly in Project admin page. There should be checklist so admins can easily enable/hide the fields in Project admin page as shown in the attachment.

*Workaround*

Edit the field configuration scheme to see that the field is hidden.
fields.summary: Enable/hide hidden field in Project's Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45688].
  {panel}

Currently when we list issues in Issue browser each issue takes too much vertical space (two lines and a separator).
It will be great if there is possibility to show more information on a single line per issue without separators. This will look much more like a *task list*, than current search results.

Current state:
--------------------------------------------------------
(T) JRA-1538
Filter on Versions .....
--------------------------------------------------------
(T) JRA-4831
User interface is not intuitive
--------------------------------------------------------

Our proposition is:
(T) (^) JRA-1538 Filter on Versions ....
(T) (-) JRA-4831 User interface is not intuitive ...

So:
- No separators
- All information per issue on a single line
- Each line have that info: issue type (icon), issue priority (icon?), issue id, issue title
fields.summary: One-liners in issues browser list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45686].
  {panel}

h2. Problem 
* The current documentation Cloud to Server documentation ([Migrating from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-jira-server-299569790.html]) does not include JIRA 7.0 specific instructions.  
* It only shows up to JIRA 6.4 
 !image-2015-10-08-15-30-16-216.png|thumbnail! 
* There is a banner stating "To get the latest and greatest features in JIRA, please upgrade to JIRA Software. Visit the Migration Hub for more information." , however there is no information on on Cloud to Server migration on the Migration Hub

h2. Suggestion
* Update  [Migrating from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-jira-server-299569790.html] to include JIRA 7.0
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud to JIRA 7 Server specific migration documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45680].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for additional platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45680].

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently JIRA ships with an older Oracle 11g database driver.

While Oracle states that 11.2 will work with Oracle 12c, the documentation also includes a table that shows JDBC Driver versions vs JDK: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#01_03. I see JDK8 is not listed with 11.2. 

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Extract a JIRA Install
# Observe the lib directory contains only an 11g driver. 

h3. Expected Results
Test and Ship or recommend a 12c driver with Oracle 12c.

h3. Actual Results
The 11.2 JDBC driver is picked up by the installer which is a little out of date.
fields.summary: Bundle and Test JIRA with an Oracle 12c Driver

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45675].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The @mention feature uses a "contains" match for the REST query to find suggested users.  The JavaScript part of the feature uses a "starts with" match.

In some environments this means no users will be suggested even though there are users that could be shown.  This makes it hard to use the @mention feature.

Example:
* User types "@joh".
* REST API returns 10 records: [^mention-rest-joh.txt]
* Very few records are shown b/c this customer uses "LastName,FirstName" and random account IDs.

!mention-joh.png|thumbnail!


h3. Suggested Solution

* Make the JavaScript use a "contains" search just like the REST call.
* Split on "," in addition to space characters to find the parts of the Display Name.

[^mention-search-contains.patch.txt]

_(This patch could not be tested because I had trouble running JIRA from source.  It's offered to help identify the relevant code)_
fields.summary: Better matching for @mention

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45673].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The mention feature does not match on account email addresses.  This makes it harder to find people you want to include in work on a ticket.

Compounding the problem, matches in the email address are bolded even though this is _not_ used for the list of suggested users. See JRA-59230.


h3. Environment
* Reproduced in JIRA 6.3.12, 6.3.15, 6.4.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a fresh JIRA installation create user accounts using the data in this list: [^mention-test-users.txt]
# Go to a JIRA issue and create a comment
# Enter text "@jo" and observe which users are shown.  Also note that "jo" at beginning of the email address is shown in bold like the matches in username and full name:
!mention-jo.png|thumbnail!
# Add an "h" onto the @mention, e.g. "@joh".

h3. Expected Results

The JEDY235544 account should be shown in the list of suggested users due to match on "johnston.cory@example.com".

h3. Actual Results

The JEDY235544 account is not suggested, only the accounts where the first name, last name, or username start with "joh".

h3. Notes

We can see that the REST calls are returning 10 users using a "contains" search.  The JavaScript component searches within those results.
* [^mention-rest-jo.txt]
* [^mention-rest-joh.txt]

h3. Suggested Solution

Make the @mention JavaScript component search on email addresses. [^option1-SearchEmail.patch.txt]

In the meantime, we should stop bolding matches in the email address. [^option2-NoEmailBolding.patch.txt]. See JRA-59230.

_(I was unable to test the patches because I had trouble running JIRA from source.  I hope they are helpful to illustrate the problem.)_
fields.summary: Mentions should support finding users with a matching email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45668].
  {panel}

When doing instance-wide cleanup work, the 'Inactive' toggle on the Workflows page is a significant hindrance. 

Each time an action is taken on a workflow from the inactive section, the 'Workflows' screen is refreshed, and the Inactive toggle is set to collapsed. That means to delete 10 workflows, we have to do the following 10 times:

   # Scroll to bottom of page
   # Toggle 'Inactive' tab to show inactive workflows
   # Locate the target workflow
   # Delete the target workflow
   # Confirm the deletion

After each deletion confirmation, we have start from step 1 again because the inactive toggle is collapsed and we cannot see the other <N> workflows that we wish to act on.

For lower skilled administrators this causes confusion especially when working with workflows of similar names. When they have expanded the inactive workflows and taken an action, they expect the inactive workflows to remain displayed, and may accidentally work on a similarly named active workflow when a search fails to find the workflow they are looking for.
fields.summary: Remember user's choice of inactive setting on Workflows page

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45656].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an Admin using the JIRA Rest API, I would like the ability to customize the CORS headers within the Whitelist Functionality or that are added by an Application Link all within JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Currently JIRA has the ability to add CORS Headers by using the [Configuring the Whitelist|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+the+Whitelist] functionality in JIRA and by adding an Application Link. I'd like the ability to specify and customize what CORS headers are added.

h3. Workaround 

No Current Workaround
fields.summary: Add CORS Header Configuration to Whitelist Rules

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45650].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA labels add-ons that are not compatible with the current version of the application but keeps the add-ons enabled.
This can cause some incompatible add-ons to break JIRA entirely, causing unexpected problems.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we could disable these add-ons automatically with the option to manually enable them to avoid unexpected problems
fields.summary: As an Admin, I'd like JIRA to disable incompatible add-ons automatically

*Suggestion Summary*

JIRA Gadget Theming

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45637].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The [JIRA Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/supported-platforms-207488170.html] documentation provides guidance on what driver to use with Oracle 11g, however it does not provide any guidance for what driver to use with Oracle 12c.

The driver that is bundled with JIRA (11.2) is the likely to be the tested driver, but there is not too much guidance around this so further documentation in this area would be helpful. 

While Oracle states that 11.2 will work with Oracle 12c, the documentation also includes a table that shows JDBC Driver versions vs JDK: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/database/enterprise-edition/jdbc-faq-090281.html#01_03. I see JDK 8 is not listed with 11.2.

h3. Suggested Solution
Document the correct Oracle Driver to use (that which has been tested).

h3. Workaround 
Use the bundled Oracle Driver.
fields.summary: Document the correct Driver version to use with Oracle 12c

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45635].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Relying on MIME type information regarding JIRA issue attachments supplied by browsers can often be unreliable, causing JIRA to store attachment data with wrong MIME types in the database. This could lead to minor issues on how this attachments should be handled when downloading from the issue since the content-header is set wrongly based on the wrong MIME type recorded in the database.

h3. Suggested Solution
A minor validation e.g. based on known file extensions should be used to determine the most appropriate file type when storing attachment data.
 
h3. Notes 
* It initially appeared JIRA already had such a feature based on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-871. However after a report from a customer, I was able to personally reproduce a scenario where JIRA basically stores the wrong MIME type (text/pdf instead of application/pdf) when a PDF file was uploaded to JIRA using Firefox with corrupt MIME type definitions library. Basically this caused issues when downloading the pdf files in other browsers because the browsers tried to render the PDF file as a text file based on the content headers sent by JIRA, resulting in gibberish characters outputted on the screen.
fields.summary: Validate attachment MIME type before storing in database
Add a warning to the bulk move operation identifying the timeout can occur if system is under load

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45627].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* User is unable to search for versions ( using the browser's search function CTRL + F ) at the bottom of the page ( is there if a long list of versions ) without scrolling the page. 
* Bug ticket has been created here https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-45626

h3. Suggested Solution
* Create a built in search function to search versions on the Versions page.
fields.summary: Build in Version Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45621].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA only support issue-level [notificaiton scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/creating-a-notification-scheme-185729542.html]. Any changes in a project will not be notified to anyone.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a project-level notification scheme or predefined set of notification scheme to [project roles|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Project+Roles] and project lead.
 
h3. Workaround 
Create a notification by [adding a custom event|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/adding-a-custom-event-185729657.html] and the respective person to be notified.
fields.summary: Project-level Notification Scheme
Allow Wiki Markup in Custom Field Description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-45618].
  {panel}

It is currently impossible to create a yes/no field without a "None" option added if the field is not "Required"

The problem with this approach is the field may not come into play until resolution time.  

So if I want to have a field like "Is X required?" and have a yes/no I can't do it, because:
* Making it required means the user needs to answer that on issue creation
* Making it optional throws in the "None" value

This is nuts.  Other fields can be null if optional, why not these?
fields.summary: Allow no or null values in radio buttons & single select fields
